channel.title: Time between parts of one case
channel.description:
I would like to divide my case into parts, I guess is a way to word it. I would like for one thing to happen, then wait a second, and continue on. (Add item, wait, add item, in other terms) How would I do this?
Thanks.

item.title: Time between parts of one case
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

I did it, and it just combined all of the pause(1000); then did the case… Without pauses.

Read full topic

That will make it wait for 1 second. However, bear in mind that it will also stop all other processing in the server, so it may not be the ideal thing to do.
[/quote]

For just that amount of milliseconds?[/quote]

correct.

item.source: Time between parts of one case

item.title: Time between parts of one case
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:5, topic:273663”][quote author=o.O O.o link=topic=361618.msg2749735#msg2749735 date=1239836766]
addItem();
pause();
addItem();
pause():

That’s what I’m going for.
[/quote]

Add a method like this:

private void pause(int milliseconds) {
	try {
		Thread.sleep(milliseconds);
	} catch (InterruptedException e) { }
}

Then you can do:

[tt]pause(1000);[/tt]

That will make it wait for 1 second. However, bear in mind that it will also stop all other processing in the server, so it may not be the ideal thing to do.[/quote]

lool i had no idea about that pause void you make. i just suggested what i knew.

to o.O O.o: Use Taharoks method, its cleaner

Read full topic
item.source: Time between parts of one case

item.title: Time between parts of one case
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“o.O O.o, post:3, topic:273663”]addItem();
pause();
addItem();
pause():

That’s what I’m going for.[/quote]

Add a method like this:

private void pause(int milliseconds) {
	try {
		Thread.sleep(milliseconds);
	} catch (InterruptedException e) { }
}

Then you can do:

[tt]pause(1000);[/tt]

That will make it wait for 1 second. However, bear in mind that it will also stop all other processing in the server, so it may not be the ideal thing to do.

Read full topic
item.source: Time between parts of one case

item.title: Time between parts of one case
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

then do this:

declare this void somewhere lol (different method with less lines xD):

public void goTime( String s )
{
    if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("pause")
    {
        timer1 = 0;
    }
    if (s.equalsIgnoreCase("go")
    {
        timer1 = 10;
    }
}

then in your case where you add the items, have it like this

addItem();
goTime("go");

in process(), have something like this then:

if (timer1 > 1)
{
    timer = -1;
}
if (timer1 == 1)
{
    addItem();
    goTime("pause");//change to "go" if you want to loop this
}

easy method really

Read full topic

item.title: Time between parts of one case
item.dc:creator: @CAPT_AMERIKA AMERIKA
item.description:
@CAPT_AMERIKA wrote:

have it set to a timer. so have something like this setup:

declare this int:

public int timer1 = 0;

then in process() , declare this countdown:

if (timer > 0) {
    timer -1;
}

and then in your code for the add item, have it set the value of timer to the number of seconds to wait x2 (since process is passed twice a second)

hope i helped

AMERIKA

Read full topic
